title: Cunard's QM2 to undergo 'significant refurbishment'
text:
Cunard has announced plans for its flagship, Queen Mary 2, to undergo “significant refurbishment” next summer. 
The news came as the line celebrated its 175 th anniversary. 
Cunard said the vessel would undergo an extensive 25-day dry dock refurbishment at the Blohm and Voss shipyard in Hamburg, Germany in May and June 2016. 
It added that the major refurbishment would “further refine and refresh guest interior spaces and launch new exciting innovations designed to exceed guest expectations”. 
Three of the key developments announced include 15 single staterooms, which will be introduced as part of the refit, as well as 30 additional Britannia Club balcony staterooms. 
Cunard also revealed that it would be adding a further 10 kennels to its existing kennels, which currently have capacity for 12 dogs and cats on each Transatlantic crossing. The line said these places were frequently sold out, and that it had decided to increase these numbers to meet the strong demand. 
It added that in order to make sure the dogs “from either side of the pond feel equally at home”, lamp posts and fire hydrants were also being installed on the area of deck reserved for dog walking. 
Angus Struthers, Cunard Director, said: “Queen Mary 2 is an icon in the world of luxury ocean travel. A ship that turns heads everywhere she goes, she is the pride of the Cunard fleet and we are committed to ensuring her reputation grows ever stronger.” 
“These enhancements are just the beginning of an exciting revitalisation for Queen Mary 2, and we look forward to making more announcements about this …refit in the coming months,” Struthers added. 
The newly announced additional accommodation will go on sale on July 15, 2015 for Queen Mary 2 Summer sailings from late June 2016.
